input.description:
The datastore on which to create the inventory objects of the VApp.
Valid value: String

Specify the name of the vApp container in the inventory
Valid value: String

The resource pool where the created VApp will be added. It may be a VApp name in case of creating one VApp in other.
Valid value: String

The parent VApp under which the VApp needs to be created.
Valid value: String

The cluster name in which the VApp will be created.
Valid value: String

The VApp from which the clone VApp has to created.
Valid value: String

The target host on which the VApp will run.
Valid value: String

The datastore on which to create the inventory objects of the VApp.
Valid value: String

The folder to which the VApp will be attached
Valid value: String

Maps one (source) network to another as part of the clone process
valid value: String

Maps one (destination) network to another as part of the clone process
valid value: String

In a resource pool with an expandable reservation, the reservation on a resource pool can grow beyond the specified value, if the parent resource pool has unreserved resources. A non-expandable reservation is called a fixed reservation. This property is ignored for virtual machines.
Valid value: “true” and “false”

The utilization of a virtual machine or a resource pool must not exceed this limit, even if there are available resources This is typically used to ensure a consistent performance of virtual machines or resource pools independent of available resources. If limit is set to -1, there is no fixed limit on resource usage and is only bounded by available resources and shares. The unit of measurement is MHz.
valid value:Number

Amount of resource that is guaranteed available to the virtual machine or resource pool Reserved resources are not wasted if they are not used. If the utilization is less than the reservation, the resources can be used by other running virtual machines. The amount of CPU to be reserved should be less than the CPU limit specified for the virtual machine. Valid value: Number

The number of shares allocated The value is used to determine resource allocation in the case of resource contention. There is no unit for this value. It is a relative measure based on the settings for other resource pools. This value is only set if the level is set to custom. Only shares with custom values can be compared. If this level is not set to custom, this value is ignored. Valid value: Number

The allocation level The level is a simplified view of shares. Levels map to a predetermined set of numeric values for shares. Valid values: ■ custom - Shares are specified in the shares column. ■ high - Shares = 2000 * number of virtual CPUs. ■ low - Shares = 500 * number of virtual CPUs. ■ normal - Shares = 1000 * number of virtual CPUs. If the shares value does not map to a predefined size, the level is set as custom.
Valid value: String

In a resource pool with an expandable reservation, the reservation on a resource pool can grow beyond the specified value, if the parent resource pool has unreserved resources. A non-expandable reservation is called a fixed reservation. This property is ignored for virtual machines.
Valid value: “true” and “false”

The utilization of a virtual machine or a resource pool must not exceed this limit, even if there are available resources This is typically used to ensure a consistent performance of virtual machines or resource pools independent of available resources. If limit is set to -1, there is no fixed limit on resource usage and is only bounded by available resources and shares. The unit of measurement is MHz.
valid value: Number

Amount of resource that is guaranteed available to the virtual appliance or resource pool Reserved resources are not wasted if they are not used. If the utilization is less than the reservation, the resources can be used by other running vapp. The amount of Memory to be reserved should be less than the Memory limit specified for the virtual machine.
Valid value: Number

The number of shares allocated The value is used to determine resource allocation in the case of resource contention. There is no unit for this value. It is a relative measure based on the settings for other resource pools. This value is only set if the level is set to custom. Only shares with custom values can be compared. If this level is not set to custom, this value is ignored.
valid value: Number

The allocation level The level is a simplified view of shares. Levels map to a predetermined set of numeric values for shares. Valid values: ■ custom - Shares are specified in the shares column. ■ high - Shares = 2000 * number of virtual CPUs. ■ low - Shares = 500 * number of virtual CPUs. ■ normal - Shares = 1000 * number of virtual CPUs. If the shares value does not map to a predefined size, the level is set as custom.
valid value: String

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <items> <item> <parameters> <datacenter>${datacenter}</datacenter> <name>${name}</name> <resource-pool>${resource pool}</resource-pool> <parent-virtual-app>${parent virtual app}</parent-virtual-app> <cluster-compute-resource>${cluster compute resource}</cluster-compute-resource> <virtual-app>${virtual app}</virtual-app> ${spec} </parameters> </item> </items> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>
